name: Framebuffer.bash
tagline: framebuffer in bash to draw ascii pixels, borders, animate e.g. (bash ui bootstrap)
body:
### Why

For minimalists and productivity fanatics.
The console is sometimes 'good enough' compared to fullfledged client/server html/css/javascript ui's.

### plugins/Barchart

`usage: barchart <x> <y> <height> "0,1,2,0,2,1,"`

The barchart plugin lets you create 3-state barcharts with ease:
lets compose our bashscript:

    repo="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/coderofsalvation/framebuffer.bash/master"
    curl "$repo/framebuffer.bash"       > barchart
    curl "$repo/plugins/barchart.bash" >> barchart

lets test a barchart:

    source barchart
    export WIDTH=22
    barchart 20 2 20 "0,1,2,2,1,2,1,0,1,2,0"
    barchart 20 4 20 "0,1,2,1,0,1,2,0"

this will produce something like this:

    ┌──────────────────────┐
    │_▄██▄█▄_▄█_________│
    ┌──────────────────────┐
    │_▄█▄_▄█_____________│
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
